Keywords: Amazon , Justice League , Kryptonian , Metropolis , Reporter , Trinity
Real Name: Kal-El
Special Powers
ROLE TAG: Captain
MOVEMENT: This character can move through Blocking terrain. Immediately after movement resolves, destroy all Blocking terrain moved through.
PICK ON SOMEONE YOUR OWN SIZE: FREE: Choose a friendly Sidekick. That character can use Invulnerability until the end of your next turn.
KRYPTONIAN SKIN AND KRYPTONIAN SENSES: Impervious, Super Senses. Protected: Outwit.

February 10, 2022
muel0017
I have owned both this guy and 059a from Rebirth and I can say, without a doubt, the Rebirth Supes is superior in every way. Also Rebirth is 100pts cheaper @ 175 for his highest.
May 4, 2021
Dortmuner
I've played him or played against him a couple times now. Once in a game where I was playing a 900 point team vs three of my friends' 300 point teams (It was my birthday spanking, and lived up to it.) and the other in a 400 point game. He's great. It's all about getting him off his Super Senses/Protected Outwit clicks, but good luck doing it. I was playing a Mystical team, so I was able to move him some when he damaged me, but he hit 6 or 8 SS rolls in a row with that 50/50 chance and would have had Imp on top of that. Now, he didn't hit a lot. The prevalence of 50/50 SS in this set as well as the Captains giving Sidekicks 18 DV, SS, Prob, etc, etc had me futilely trying to punch a Future Foundation kid while the real fight raged around me, and the game where he was attacking me, Prob, Impervious, and a 22 DV for First Born minimized his offense, but that's the state of the game, especially when playing higher point games with more support. Yes, very expensive, especially for a 300 point team, but he's a lot of fun.
May 4, 2021
Geof-Force
The dial itself is great. The point cost though compared to the OP Marvel with similar weightclass, is meh. 275 points is just way too much in the current meta of cheap bighitters with utility abilities.

March 10, 2021
Emtemss
You know, I keep going back and forth on this dial. The sculpt is fantastic, but the dial, it just exemplifies "Starter Pack" and not "Lucky Pull" to me. It's arguably the most generic Superman ever built, and likely the one that is least worth their points. At 275 Points that basically puts him in the weight class of things like GED and Superman Prime a this mid point dial, but he couldn't hang with either of them, not even close. I think he is a great beginners Superman, especially because at that point cost he is likely to be one of the biggest hitters a new player has starting out right now. I also think it's amusing how the dial is so bland, so generic, that this could be any of the multitude of Superman clone characters. Hyperion? Yup. Gladiator? Sure. Omni-Man? You bet. He is so plain jane that he could be anyone. And maybe that's why his moment in the Sun is unlikely to last very long.
March 3, 2021
Dortmuner
[QUOTE=Goop;12118459]Honestly this guy is only going to be as good as his Super Senses rolls are. Otherwise he is extremely vulnerable to psyblast/Exploit Weakness. He does get one crazy charge and massive hit for 6 but after that, with Invincible being benched and no stop clicks i just dont see him living that long. For 275pts i want him to have much better survivability or more than one attack per turn. I like him a lot better at 125 line.[/QUOTE] That's a 50/50 Super Senses and an Impervious roll on top of that. I like his odds of rolling out of hits.

[QUOTE=Goop;12118459]Honestly this guy is only going to be as good as his Super Senses rolls are. Otherwise he is extremely vulnerable to psyblast/Exploit Weakness. He does get one crazy charge and massive hit for 6 but after that, with Invincible being benched and no stop clicks i just dont see him living that long. While that is the case that he is extremely vulnerable to penetrating, there is one Emil Hamilton for 25 points in the JLU set who could help reduce that weakness and still work thematically (dial below). or if you are mean, you could put the silver surfboard on him. I do agree that they should have given him some more offense and some more protection, but he is a common, so what do you expect? [inlinedial]jlu023[/inlinedial]

March 3, 2021
deathtrooper744
I never thought I could like a Superman without HSS and/or Super Strength, but boy was I wrong. 13 atk, 6 damage, 8 square charge reach, 15 movement!, and not to forget 19 defense super senses on a 4-6 along with Impervious. Of course, he'll always be demolished by Pulse Wave, or penetrating damage (minus super senses). But, I think that is accurate for his comicbook weaknesses
